page.title: 18OLD BUILDINGS OF WHITKIRK
page.content: Although now a suburb of Leeds, {Whitkirk in 1985}still has plenty of evidence of{its village past.}Apart from the church (see page 15) there are{several old houses}including the {Manor House.}This still shows its stone mullion windows, and the old stable block can be seen across the road. {The terrace of houses opposite the {church}include the{old brewery}from which the beer would be carried across the main road to the{village pub {"The Brown Cow".}Several of these houses display a small cross of the {Knights Templar,}who previously owned much of the village. {"The Brown Cow"}gets its name from the cattle market which used to be housed in a round brick building just to the rear. This building is now a supermarket.
